fields.description:
A user "Shared" a page using the Share button and added many users to the share. After completing the entry of his message, the user discovered that he could not complete the Share by clicking the Share button because the dialog box extended below the end of the page. Scrolling down to the bottom of the page showed that the dialog box disappeared off the page!

Clicking outside the dialog box closed the share so the message and user selection were lost.

Ideally, the dialog box should not extend past the end of the page.
fields.summary: Share button can't be pushed because the Share dialog box too long

fields.description:
Updating status in Confluence 4.0 with the following emoticons will result in broken images [^brokenemoticon.jpg]:

# :)
# :(
# :P
# :D
# ;)
# (y)
# (n)
# (?)
fields.summary: Broken Emoticons in Status Update in Confluence 4.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23372].
  {panel}

*Current Situation*
One defined email address has to be configured as "From Address" when sending email notifications (on Admin Console -> Mailserver). All notification emails are sent from this address. When recipient "blindly" replies to this email, it is sent to the defined address rather than to the modifier causing the notfication to be sent.

*Desired Situation*
On general Mailserver configuration, the variable ${email} is available for "From Address", just as it is available for "From Name":
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+Server+for+Outgoing+Mail
Meaning: Emails should be sent from the address of the modifier. In this case, the recpient will directly contact the modifier when replying to the notification email.
fields.summary: Use modifiers email as from address in email notifications

fields.description: The multimedia macro places videos too low on the page.  Please see attachment.
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro places video too low on page

fields.description:
Navmap displays duplicate page titles if a previous version of that page has been accessed. e.g. If you have a page called Testing at version 5 and you visit a previous version such as 4, the navmap macro will then display the page Testing twice (one linking to version 5 and the other version 4).

Example can be seen here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF33/Navmap+Macro 

Please could the navmap be set to the "current version" of the page to prevent duplication.
fields.summary: Navmap Macro displays previous page versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23368].
  {panel}

Background:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13719/what-happens-when-every-confluence-developer-adds-their-macro-to-the-featured-macros-section-in-the-editor

Too many "Featured Macros" means that the "Insert" dropdown drops off the bottom of the screen

Disabling web-items for each plugin in the plugin configuration screen for that plugin is not exactly user friendly -- Its very unpleasant in fact.

Suggestion: Add a "Configure Featured Macros" screen where an admin can choose which macros are displayed and which are not
fields.summary: Featured macros in the insert menu don't scale well

fields.description:
* Insert a link to an anchor on the same page
* Insert a link to an anchor on a different page
* Export to PDF

Check the links in the generated PDF file. The first one will be a link to the anchor point within the PDF. The second will be a link to the anchor point in the Confluence instance.

A user would expect these to be consistent.
fields.summary: Anchor links have inconsistent behaviour in space PDF exports

fields.description:
On a new 4.0.1 installation, the demo space will contain links to other pages in the demo space - these will be absolute.

This means that links on copied pages in the demo space will have different behaviour to links on new and updated  content. This could be confusing for a user.

The same issue will affect space imports which contain absolute links.


Version = 4.0.1-SNAPSHOT
URL = http://chang:8080/confluence/display/ds/Welcome+to+the+Confluence+Demonstration+Space
Browser = Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0
fields.summary: Demo Space and other imported spaces will still contain absolute links instead of relative links

fields.description:
We found a major issue using the transformer plugin module type. This issue blocks us releasing our Scroll Wiki Exporter plugins and may also influence plugins of other providers.

In {{com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.PluggableTransformerChain}} a PriorityQueue is used to sort weighted transformers. Later an iterator is used to execute each of them. Our problem is that iterating a PriorityQueue does not guarantee the ordering. Please refer to [PriorityQueue documentation|http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/PriorityQueue.html]

_The Iterator provided in method iterator() is not guaranteed to traverse the elements of the priority queue in any particular order. If you need ordered traversal, consider usingArrays.sort(pq.toArray())._
fields.summary: Transformer chain ignores specified weights

h5. Use cases
There are some customers that use JIRA issues macro in their dashboard, by either one of the following:
- Adding it through Site Welcome Message
- Adding it by customising Global Layout or vm files

h5. Workaround
- Create a new page. For example, titled "_IncludeMe"
- Add the jiraissues macro in that page and save it
- Remove your jiraissues macro from wherever you put it (eg. Site Welcome Message or Global Layout) and replace it with this instead:
{noformat}
{include:SPACEKEY:_IncludeMe}
{noformat}
- JIRA issues macro now should be rendered fine in Dashboard.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro can no longer be rendered by the wiki markup renderer (eg. Dashboard welcome message, User Macros, unmigrated wiki markup blocks)

fields.description:
In Firefox and Chrome you can't download a powerpoint file containing special characters in the filename using the view file macro. In my example I attached the file "umlaute_öäüÖÜÄß.pptx" to the page and added this macro: {viewppt:name=umlaute_öäüÖÜÄß.pptx}. Clicking on the download-link inside the macro works in Internet Explorer 8 and points to this url: https://some.host/download/attachments/12345/umlaute_%C3%B6%C3%A4%C3%BC%C3%96%C3%9C%C3%84%C3%9F.pptx. In FireFox and Chrome however, the link points to https://some.host/download/attachments/12345/umlaute_%F6%E4%FC%D6%DC%C4%DF.pptx and I get a page not found error. So IE uses url-encoding with UTF-8 (which does work) and FireFox & Chrome are using url-encoding with ISO 8859-1, which does not. As a workaround you can download the files directly from the viewpageattachments-page, the download there works fine, even in FireFox & Chrome.

Edit: This is still occurring with later versions of Firefox (up to 29), but no longer in Chrome (at least in version 36).  

*Workarounds are:*

* Rename the file
* Download files from the View Page Attachments page directly
fields.summary: FF & Chrome fail to download ppt-documents via view file macro, if the filename contains special characters, due to encoding problems

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23343].
  {panel}

With our upgrade to Confluence 4 we have lost the wiki markup editor and since I already saw that it is not likely it will return, I will at least ask for some productivity improvements:

* I'd like a simple (non-pop-up-form) way to create a wiki link. I seem to have to go through a form in order to insert a link to a wiki page. (My typical case is that I first add the link and then click it to craete the page)
* I'd like the "insert jira issue" function to also popup in the autocomplete when I start with {jira, which now only shows the JIRA Issues and JIRA Portlet macro. (I know there is a keyboard shortcut, but still it feels inconsistent)
* I'd like a way to quickly "copy/paste" certain markup. E.g. I used to create one jira issue link and then copy/paste that, changing the number, instead of going through the "insert jira issue" form. This new insert approach is much slower.
* I'd like that the removal of text blocks like a note is more "seamless". E.g. When I am after a note section and press backspace, it actually stops. (Although I must admit that sometimes I seem to end up inside the note area). So I often have the feeling that I have to do some selection trick or grab my mouse in order to delete a text block, like a note.

While I am impressed by the features of the new editor I can't help feel that my productivity is severely impaired by having many simple things now awkwardly hard and requiring "forms".
fields.summary: Productivity suggestions for new wiki editor (things I used to do more efficiently in the wiki markup editor)

Here is the scenario:
* I have groups called *GroupA* and *GroupB*
* *GroupA* is being pulled into Confluence with a LDAP directory defined in Confluence
* *GroupB* is a member of *GroupA*, but is *not* part of the LDAP filter defined in the LDAP directory within Confluence

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Demonstration Space in Confluence 3.5.x
# Browse to this blog-post: "Movember at Atlassian - Oooo we're half way there, oooooo oh..."
# Edit the page/blog and add the link to an image attached to it in wiki markup editor:
{code}
[^MoOfTheWeek.png]
{code}
# Upgrade to 4.0
# The link will be greyed out and no longer working

h5. Workaround
Edit the page/blog, remove the link and re-add it.

h5. Finding
- XHTML of the migrated content:
{code}
<ac:link>
	<ri:attachment ri:filename="MoOfTheWeek.png">
		<ri:page ri:content-title="Movember at Atlassian - Oooo we're half way there, oooooo oh..." ri:space-key="ds" />
	</ri:attachment>
</ac:link>
{code}
-- If I edit the migrated XHTML to be like this, it works:
{code}
<ac:link>
	<ri:attachment ri:filename="MoOfTheWeek.png">
		<ri:blog-post ri:posting-day="2011/02/08" ri:content-title="Movember at Atlassian - Oooo we're half way there, oooooo oh..." ri:space-key="ds" />
	</ri:attachment>
</ac:link>
{code}
- XHTML of the new re-added link:
{code}
<ac:link>
	<ri:attachment ri:filename="MoOfTheWeek.png" />
</ac:link>
{code}

h3.If you are upgrading to any versions after 4.0.3

*Make sure to upgrade first, to 4.0.3*, ensure *all blogposts* are migrated correctly (else, rerun the migration *in 4.0.3*), before upgrading to the version of your choice. (This is fixed only in 4.0.3's wiki to xhtml migration)
fields.summary: Link to an attachment of a blog post is no longer working after the content migrated to XHTML

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23336].
  {panel}

Importing Word document with images into Confluence page will generate notifications for each of the images which causing users being spammed with emails.

Only one notification is expected for the one Word document.

h5. Workaround
You can disable a system add-on that sends notifications on attachment uploads to pages to work around this, but it will disable uploads of any attachments to any pages, not just on Word imports.

The following steps will disable the specific modules that send this notification:
 # Go to !http://i.imgur.com/Ew0T0kz.png! *-> Add-ons -> All add-ons (from the drop-down)*
 # Look for *Confluence File Notifications* and expand it 
 # Open the modules of the add-on
 # Disable *file-content-update-notification* & *file-content-delete-notification*

You won't get any notifications of attachment events anymore until this module is re-enabled.

(!) *On the version 5.10.x or later, the module name is changed to:*
* file-content-update-notification
* file-content-remove-notification

And disabling these 2 modules will not have any impact on the attachment upload functionality.
fields.summary: Importing from Word document with images should not generate notifications for each images

Confluence occasionally throws DataIntegrityViolationException when rendering thumbnails.

Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: Duplicate entry '22941110' for key 'PRIMARY'

The behaviour of images on a page is not what a user would expect after the content is pasted from another page. This can cause confusion, for example, when using a restricted page to make a draft, then copying that content into a new page/blog post.

# Create *Page B* which is public
# Copy and paste the content of *Page A* into *Page B*, and save

# Delete *Page A*, and then the images on *Page B* will be broken for all users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23328].
  {panel}

That is, \[#foo\] on a page called "Test Page" renders with an alias / link body of "Test Page#foo". In Confluence 3.5 we only displayed "foo" which is a lot nicer. 

This was raised as regression in some of our documentation pages. 

!Anchorlinks-busted.PNG!

----

The second part of this issue is to make anchor links relative again in Confluence 4.0+, which isn't the case in the initial Confluence 4.0 release.

In other words, if a link leads to a target location on the same page (e.g. an anchor link), then in the XHTML storage format, don't store the page reference in the link itself. This was how Confluence 3.5 effectively used to work (in part because its content was stored in 'less sophisticated' wiki markup). However, since all links were treated as absolute links in the initial release of Confluence 4.0, this was causing all sorts of problems like:

* Displaying the page name and # character for relative anchor links
* https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/CPSP-45

(/) For an initial discussion on how Confluence 4.0 should handle anchor links 'relatively', see [this comment on CPSP-45|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/CPSP-45?focusedCommentId=49069&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-49069]
fields.summary: We display the page name and # character for relative anchor links + make anchor links relative (in the XHTML storage format for Confluence 4.0+).

Webkit problems - deleting or backspacing the last character or image in the placeholder removes the whole placeholder - delete inside a placeholder moves cursor up (we should stay in place or else only delete subsequent content as in MS word) - when there are 2 empty paragraphs in the placeholder, deleting the first paragraph or backspacing the second removes the placeholder - selecting the whole contents of the placeholder (where there is a single or multiple lines of content with inline markup), pressing delete or backspace removes the whole placeholder - if there are multiple lines of content in the placeholder and the last line contains an empty list item, selecting the whole contents and hitting backspace or delete removes the whole placeholder - when there is a single list item inside the placeholder, pressing backspace or delete removes the whole placeholder - when there is a single word styled with strong, italics and underline inside the placeholder, pressing backspace or delete removes the whole placeholder - delete leaves behinds

h4. Firefox problems - deleting the last character in the placeholder causes an extra line to be inserted into the body of the placeholder: {code}



{code} Notice the BR outside of the P -- this is responsible for the extra line.

fields.description:
In the past I have edited Confluence pages directly in wiki markup for five reasons.

# The pre-4.0 RTF editor was not very capable and would do things incorrectly that required editing the markup to fix (important).
# I could set things up using markup to look the way I wanted with absolutely the minimal markup.
# I could independently copy the wiki markup of finished pages and save it in a text file on my local system disk and a USB drive as a form of redundant backup, which has saved my work more than once (really important).
# I could edit the wiki markup in a text editor off-line (our company Confluence system is not accessible from off-site), bring it back, and paste it in, which allowed me to continue working on trips (very important).
# I can edit wiki markup much faster using just a keyboard than using the RTF editor with a mouse and keyboard.

With the elimination of the wiki markup editor in Confluence 4.0, I now no longer have the ability to work offsite or independently store backup copies of my pages in text.

Please supply a way for users to edit the XHMTL source text so I can independently back up my pages, work offline, and better use my offsite time.  Supplying an "XHTML" button that when clicked puts the XHMTL source into a webpage with a single giant text field and "Save" and "Cancel" buttons will restore all the advantages that the Wiki Markup editor gave me.

In addition, make sure the RTF editor supports the HTML "div" tag so we can easily format our web pages the way we want.  Thank you!
fields.summary: Allow Users to Directly Edit the XHMTL Source Text for Confluence Pages

fields.description:
Please bring back either the wiki markup editor, or simply the ability to export a page in wiki markup. The insert wiki markup editor is helpful but useless if I can't export the wiki markup to make my change directly in.

Editing in wiki markup is fast and allows me to conduct work offline.
fields.summary: Wiki Markup Export or Editor

fields.description:
As originally described in my comments to CONF-21986, Confluence has a bad habit of reporting deadlocks and failing to handle plugin installations gracefully.

This was observed when trying to upgrade the Adaptavist Plugin Licensing Manager plugin to v0.6.1, while running a recently-upgraded Confluence 4.0 in a production environment:

{code}
2011-09-23 11:51:39,838 INFO [Spring executor 11] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] notifyPluginDisabled Disabling com.adaptavist.confluence.contentFormattingMacros
2011-09-23 11:51:43,336 INFO [Spring executor 11] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] disableDependentPlugins Found dependent enabled plugins for uninstalled plugin 'com.adaptavist.plm.plugin.plm-plugin': [].  Disabling...
2011-09-23 11:51:43,337 INFO [Spring executor 11] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] notifyPluginDisabled Disabling com.adaptavist.plm.plugin.plm-plugin
2011-09-23 11:52:35,488 ERROR [Spring executor 11] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
 -- referer: http://172.16.16.10:8090/confluence/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /confluence/rest/plugins/1.0/upgrades/all | userName: scott
2011-09-23 11:52:35,490 ERROR [Spring executor 11] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
 -- referer: http://172.16.16.10:8090/confluence/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /confluence/rest/plugins/1.0/upgrades/all | userName: scott
2011-09-23 11:52:40,333 INFO [pool-6-thread-1] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] notifyPluginDisabled Disabling com.adaptavist.plm.plugin.plm-plugin-installer
{code}

We initially discovered what appears to be the same issue when developing one of our own plugins, which may shed some additional light on the problem. It seems that our plugin's Spring initialization is getting invoked while Confluence still holds a lock on some part of the plugin table. Our initialization code sometimes tries to modify other plugin modules (primarily, we call PluginController.disablePluginModule to disable incompatible modules of other plugins), which sometimes provokes a deadlock identical tot he above:

{code}
2011-09-16 16:04:21,439 INFO [pool-6-thread-2] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] disableDependentPlugins Found dependent enabled plugins for uninstalled plugin 'com.arsenale.plugins.lockpoint': []. Disabling...
2011-09-16 16:04:21,441 INFO [pool-6-thread-2] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] updatePlugin Updating plugin 'com.arsenale.plugins.lockpoint' to 'com.arsenale.plugins.lockpoint'
2011-09-16 16:04:21,443 INFO [pool-6-thread-2] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] notifyPluginDisabled Disabling com.arsenale.plugins.lockpoint
2011-09-16 16:04:23,133 ERROR [http-8090-5] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction
- referer: http://172.16.16.10:8090/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /rest/plugins/1.0/pending/008decc2-f4fb-421f-a4f0-6d05489257d7 | userName: admin
2011-09-16 16:04:23,134 ERROR [http-8090-5] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
- referer: http://172.16.16.10:8090/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /rest/plugins/1.0/pending/008decc2-f4fb-421f-a4f0-6d05489257d7 | userName: admin
{code}

If we call the above method too soon after our plugin gets initialized, we deadlock. If we wait a while before trying to disable the other plugin modules, everything works correctly. One correlating factor is that if we have not seen our own PluginInstallEvent by the time we try to call disablePluginModule(), we seem to deadlock. But once we've received that event, we seem to be okay.

In either case, the upgraded plugin is dead in the water after attempting the installation.
fields.summary: Database deadlock during upgrade of plugins

fields.description:
When the contents of a code block is copy&pasted into another code block, then it loses all its formatting. Please see the attached screenshot for an example.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a blank page.
# Insert a code block macro.
# Type some formatted code with indentation etc.
# Create another code block macro.
# Copy and paste the code into the second code block.
# Now all formatting is lost and the code is inserted as a single line.

When the code is instead pasted into the normal page body, the formatting is preserved.
fields.summary: Code that is pasted into another code block loses all its formatting

{noformat}

It should be possible to have more than 12 parameters to a user macro as this doesn't affect other DB. 

h5. Possible Cause
We found out that the described error is the result of the column BANDANAVALUE in table BANDANA being too small (CLOB(100000)) in DB2. We have many large user macros so it is only possible to enter a few macros until the maximum column size is reached. In MySQL this column is of type mediumtext, which is larger.

h5. Workaround
We worked around the error by manually enlarging the column via db2 command.
fields.summary: BANDANA.BANDANAVALUE is too small in DB2 and prevents User Macro to be saved when it exceeds the limit

fields.description: After the upgrade from Confluence 3.5.9 to 4.0 no space cannot be accessed anymore. Every time a "Page not found" error is raised, including when attempting the personal space. However, the administration pages do work and the dashboard is displayed correctly.
fields.summary: After upgrading to Confluence 4.0 every space causes a Page not found error

fields.description:
I upgraded to Confluence 4 last night (from Confluence 3.5.5) & when trying to add new pages or edit any existing pages, the page only loads the title.

+*Steps To Reproduce The Issue*+
# Upgrade to Confluence 4 (with an existing database of pages)
# Either:
## Try to create a new page in any space.
## Open any of the existing pages after the upgrade & click Edit at the top right corner

+*Expected Behavior*+
The page should open correctly & the add/edit page should open correctly (after step 2.2) showing the Rich Text Format & the Wiki Markup options

+*Actual Behavior*+
The page opens correctly but when clicking the Edit button, only the title box is showing (as if the page didn't load properly). Check attached screenshot
fields.summary: Can't Add Or Edit Pages After Upgrade To Confluence 4

fields.description: Currently the temp dir cleaning job kicks in at 4 am (I believe it is). If a re-indexing is happening at that time the job will delete the indecies built and the re-indexing will fail with strange and hard to decipher error messages. When re-indexing starts the temp cleaning job should be disabled, and be re-enabled once the indexing is done.
fields.summary: TempDir cleaner will break re-indexing if indexing is happening at time of running
Unable to insert macros using chrome

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
Scenario 1
1. Edit a page
2. Add the status macro.
3. Select the lozenge created by the status macro: click link.
4. Use the search dialog to link to any page within confluence.
5. Save.  Lozenge is replaced by link

Scenario 2
1. Edit a page.
2. Add the status macro.
3. Select the lozenge created by the status macro: click link
4. Use the weblink dialog and paste a url into the box referring to an internal confluence page (or any page for that matter)
5. Save.  A lozenge is created that when clicked, links you to the external resource.

Preferred Scenario: 2.
fields.summary: Inconsistant behavior when using link dialog on elements generated by macros

In Safari a copy / paste copies the cell INTO the cell you paste the buffer.  Screenshot attached demonstrating how it behaves in the Safari version listed in environment.

fields.description:
There is an unclosed div in the vm called by the \{space-details\} macro. \confluence\spaces\viewspacedetails.vm It's missing the closing tag for this div:
This causes formatting issues with the following content, noticeably when there are comments on the page. The comments have list numbering because the missing closing div tag brings them inside the div classed 'wiki-content', and this negates the css that hides the list numbering for comments. I have checked and seen this error in viewspacedetails.vm for Confluence 4.0, 3.4.9, 3.0.1 so possibly affects all versions from 3.0 to 4.0 h3. Workaround Edit the {{confluence/spaces/viewspacedetails.vm}} file and append the following line to the end: {code:html}
{code}
fields.summary: VM for Space Details Macro Has an Error

fields.description:
h3.Symptoms
Context paths are missing, and connecting to Confluence via Apache's mod_jk fails. However, connecting to Confluence using [http://localhost:<port>] works.

h3.Cause
Confluence 4.0's upgrade manager does not copy over any modifications from the previous installation's server.xml, including AJP connectors, context paths, etc. 

h3.Workaround
Ensure there is a backup of server.xml before upgrading to 4.0. After the upgrade, proceed to replace the server.xml in {{Confluence4InstallationDir/conf}} with the backup copy.
fields.summary: Confluence 4.0 upgrade does not take into account modifications in server.xml

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23286].
  {panel}

We need ability to specify columns with their widths, e.g.
columns=key:10%,description:70%,resolution:20%

or alternatively in pixel
columns=key:100,description:600,resolution:200

Idea is that same will be passed onto the JavaScript implementing the grid display and also into the PDF Exporter.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro ability to pass column widths

fields.description:
When trying to customize the space look and feel while a theme is active, the german message contains several unrelated words at the beginning. Please see the attached screenshot for an example.
* English: _You can not customise the site look and feel while a theme is active. You must first disable the currently configured theme._
* German: _*B. 2.2.x oder 2.3.x) exportiert wurden.* Sie können die Site-Gestaltung nicht anpassen, während ein Design aktiv ist._
The *bold* text should not be there.

The corresponding properties key is {{theme.set}} in file {{confluence-de_DE-plugin-1.24.jar!ConfluenceActionSupport_de_DE.properties}}.

The correct translation would be:
* _Sie können die Site-Gestaltung nicht anpassen, während ein Design aktiv ist. Sie müssen das aktuell konfigurierte Design zuerst deaktivieren._
fields.summary: Wrong german message when space layout cannot be customized

fields.description:
The tip/info/warning etc panels in Confluence 4 seem to have a visual defect when a title is not used.

The body text of the panel is out of alignment with the icon, when no title is set.
With a title however, it looks fine.

See screenshots for an example.

fields.description:
Hi,

Every Japanese characters in macro placeholder are displayed as '□'.
Perhaps, the other multi-byte characters (e.g. Chinese characters, etc) also may cause a similar phenomenon.

I think that it seems that Confluence new editor doesn't correctly process both 'data-macro-parameters' and 'data-macro-name' attribute values in the table element. See my attached screenshots.

This problem has an impact upon Japanese users.
I hope that it will be fixed immediately.

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa
fields.summary: Multi-byte characters in macro placeholder aren't displayed at all.
Labels are not copied from Page Templates

fields.description:
The pagetress macro is useful in providing a summary of the organization of pages within a space. However, reading and searching through the text-only menu quickly gets cumbersome for large spaces with many levels of pages. It would be more useful if there were a macro similar to the pagetree macro that generated a visual map of how the pages connect to each other instead of just displaying page names in a folder-like representation, perhaps something resembling a flowchart from Gliffy.Hi Andrea!

Ideally the visual representation would clearly indicate levels in the page tree, and also how the pages connect to each other. Another feature that could be useful is visual indication of orphaned pages. In keeping with the current pagetree macro functionality, each visual block representing a page in this visual diagram should be linked to the appropriate pages, and the user should have the option to generate the visual tree for all children pages, all pages in a particular space, etc.

Could this feature be implemented as part of the Jira Studio bundle for a future release?

Thank you.
fields.summary: A visual representation from a pagetree-like macro

fields.description:
1. For security reasons our confluence instance has no internet connection.
2. Create a page containing a viewppt macro.
3. Try to export this page to PDF. It should take a long time (>10min). This is caused by the export agent when he tries to connect to adobe:

{code}
2011-09-20 11:34:02,124 WARN [http-80-6] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent] getImageResource Could not retrieve image resource http://www.adobe.com/images/shared/download_buttons/get_flash
_player.gif during Confluence export
- url: /spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action | page: 12353649 | userName: admin | referer: http://SERVERNAME/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=12353649 | action: pdfpageexport
{code}
fields.summary: PDF export takes a long time if a page contains a viewppt macro and no internet connection is available

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
- be logged in as a member of {{confluence-administrators}} group
- do not have the "view" permission on the space, neither directly nor through a group
- Anonymous do not have "view" permission on the space
- go to {{Space > Pages > Alphabetical}} and you'll get:
{noformat}
There are no pages starting with ''.
{noformat}
!BrowsePages_AlphabeticalView.PNG!
- {{Space > Pages > Tree}} view and {{Space > Pages > Recently Updated}} shows fine due to CONF-20697

Although being a {{confluence-administrators}} user, if the user doesn't have Space view permission, all the 3 Pages view should not show anything even though the pages are still accessible by direct access.
fields.summary: Pages > Alphabetical view shows "There are no pages starting with ''." when accessed by confluence-administrator user that doesn't have Space Permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23262].
  {panel}

With the introduction of Confuence 4, we have more power to get things done quicker.  The property panel now gives us the power to quickly change aspects of a macro without having to remember macro syntax.
 
It would be great to have more input options on the property panel
* text field (like the image macro)
* drop down list

Additionally, an official way to style a button would be nice.
fields.summary: Confluence 4 - Property Panel - Input Fields
